intro: Ilysanthes congesta, commonly known as the clustered bellflower, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its compact growth habit and ornamental flowers make it a popular choice for rock gardens and alpine settings. Ilysanthes congesta is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
